page.title: 18HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content: The area, which is mostly residential, has two housing estates. One was built in the 1930s and the other in the late 1960s. Stanley Hill is a main road connecting them. Near Lincoln Park are a lot of farming fields and school fields. On the other side of them, in White Lion Close and around it,are some 1950s houses. Below this is London Road. It has ribbon development on the left,all built from the 1950s to the present day.On the other side are fields. These are pasture lands for dairy cattle and cereal crops with a small woodland at the back. LONDON ROAD.There are 17 detached houses;16 semi-detached houses;1 new bungalow; Westrow farm, which sells eggs and mushrooms; a builder's and a gas sub-station near the bus-stop on the Amersham/Windsor route.On the opposite side are open fields.
